title: Onion Tart with Sherry Peppers Sauce
requires: An 11-inch tart pan with a pre-cooked pastry dough shell (see Pastry Dough Tart Shell) Tomato Basil Concassé as an accompaniment
ingredients: 1½ tablespoons Sherry Peppers Sauce or white-wine Worcestershire sauce
1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme or ¼ teaspoon dried
instructions: In a heavy kettle cook the onions in the oil, covered, over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.  Uncover the kettle and continue cooking the onions over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour, or until they are golden brown.  Add the flour and cook the mixture, stirring, for 1 minute, and remove the kettle for the heat.  Stir in 1 cup of the half-and-half and combine the mixture well.  In a large bowl whish together the eggs, the remaining 1 cup half-and-half, the Sherry Peppers Sauce, the salt, and the thyme, the onion mixture, and combine the filling well.
Put the tart pastry shell on a baking sheet and pour the filling into it, and bake the tart in the middle of a preheated oven (375° F.) for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the filling is set.
Let the tart cool in the pan on a rack for 15 minutes.
Serve the tart warm with the Tomato Basil Concassé.
Source:  Cuisine Courante:  A Luncheon in Bermuda, Gourmet Magazine, May 1991.  See picture at bottom of the Tomato Basis Concassé recipe.
